original: Fredriksson, Torsten Emanuel, häradshövding, Kalmar, f. 14/11/94 i Kalm. av Pehr F. o. Emma Johnsson. G. 3S> m. Margit Odelstierna. — Jur. kand. i Upps. 20’ assess. i Göta hovr. 26, fiskal 29, hovr:råd 31, tf. rev:sekr. s. å., rev:sekr. 36, här:hövd i Södra Möre doms. fr. 38. Sekr. i malt dr :komm. 34-36, led. i A-B Smål. Banks avd:styr. 29, ordf. i län’sarb:nd 40, v. ordf. 45, ordf. i pohskoll. i Kalm. 1. ’Siöfdna llandisitingsiomir. 40, li :anis(t:nd! i Katear 46. RNO 34.
translated: Fredriksson, Torsten Emanuel, district judge, Kalmar, born on November 14, 1894 in Kalm (Kalmar) to Pehr F. and Emma Johnsson. Married three times, last to Margit Odelstierna. He received his Bachelor of Laws degree from Uppsala University in 1920 and became an assessor in Göta Court of Appeal in 1926. He was appointed as a prosecutor in 1929, became a court advisor in 1931, acting revenue secretary the same year, revenue secretary in 1936, and district judge in Södra Möre  from 1938 onwards. He served as secretary in the malt liquor commission from 1934-36, was a member of the board of A-B Smål Banks from 1929, chairman of the county labor union in 1940, vice chairman in 1945, chairman of the poultry school in Kalm and a member of the Seydlitz Landstorm Squadron in 1940, and member of the church council in Katear in 1946. He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star in 1934.

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star
